alert.note: Alert for Big Island Summit (Hawaii) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Winter Storm Warning issued December 19 at 3:31AM HST until December 20 at 6:00AM HST by NWS Honolulu
info.description: ...WINTER STORM WARNING IN EFFECT THROUGH 6 AM HST TUESDAY.. ...WINTER STORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 6 AM HST TUESDAY... * WHAT...Heavy snow and blowing snow. Blizzard-like conditions possible. Additional snow accumulations of up to 8 inches. Winds gusting as high as 100 mph. * WHERE...Big Island Summits above 10,500 feet elevation. * WHEN...Until 6 AM HST Tuesday. * IMPACTS...Travel could be very difficult to impossible. Blowing snow will significantly reduce visibility at times, with periods of zero visibility.
info.instruction: A Winter Storm Warning means significant amounts of snow, sleet, and ice are expected or occurring. Strong winds are also possible. This will make travel very hazardous or impossible. Any travel plans to the summits should be postponed until the threat diminishes.
